Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Pulmonary Endarterectomy for Chronic Thromboembolic Pulmonary Hypertension

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial was conducted at four high-volume CTEPH centers.

Participants.evidence: Participants were adults diagnosed with operable CTEPH.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group underwent PEA, while the control group received standard medical therapy.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) measured at 6 months post-intervention.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group allocation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised: 100 to the PEA group and 100 to the control group, between January 2020 and June 2021.

Number_Analysed.evidence: In the intention-to-treat analysis, 98 participants in the PEA group and 97 in the control group were analysed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The PEA group showed a significant reduction in PVR compared to the control group (mean difference = 5.2 mm Hg, 95% CI 3.1 to 7.3; p = 0.01).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were reported in 3/100 (3%) of the PEA group and 1/98 (1%) of the control group, with mild gastrointestinal side-effects.

Funding.evidence: This research did not receive any specific grant from funding agencies in the public, commercial, or not-for-profit sectors.
